#define COOK ( value   ) 
Value:
({                                                                      \
        int radix = 0;                                                  \
        while (value > 1024) {                                          \
                value /= 1024;                                          \
                radix++;                                                \
        }                                                               \
        radix;                                                          \
})

Value:
"\tstripe_size:  Number of bytes on each OST (0 filesystem default)\n" \

        "\tstart_ost_idx: OST index of first stripe (-1 default)\n"     \

Function Documentation

static int check_lease ( int  fd,
bool *  lease_broken,
bool  group_locked,
const char *  path 
) [static]

Internal helper for migrate_copy_data().

Check lease and report error if need be.

Parameters:
[in] fd File descriptor on which to check the lease.
[out] lease_broken Set to true if the lease was broken.
[in] group_locked Whether a group lock was taken or not.
[in] path Name of the file being processed, for error reporting
Return values:
0 Migration can keep on going.
-errno Error occurred, abort migration.

static int parse_targets ( __u32 *  osts,
int  size,
int  offset,
char *  arg 
) [static]

Parse a string containing an OST index list into an array of integers.

The input string contains a comma delimited list of individual indices and ranges, for example "1,2-4,7". Add the indices into the osts array and remove duplicates.

Parameters:
[out] osts array to store indices in
[in] size size of osts array
[in] offset starting index in osts
[in] arg string containing OST index list
Return values:
positive number of indices in osts
-EINVAL unable to parse arg
